newsitem.title: USA: Montgomery Ward defines target customer.
newsitem.headline: Montgomery Ward defines target customer.

text.p: Montgomery Ward & Co Inc plans to target middle-income female shoppers and focus on its core appliance and furniture businesses in an effort to turn the ailing retail chain around.

Ward said Tuesday it would remodel four to six stores early next year to boost sales and attract its target customer, which it identified as a female shopper between 30 and 55 years old earning an annual household income of $25,000 to $50,000.

"We have worked diligently during the past several months to develop a comprehensive strategic plan that will reposition the company, revise our financial structure and improve the planning process," Roger Goddu, Montgomery Ward's chairman and chief executive, said in a statement. "Our initiatives will focus on our merchandise strengths."
The strategy was formed after interviews with 3,000 consumers and 500 Montgomery Ward managers by a market research firm, said spokeswoman Judy Gustafson.

The retailer, which operates 346 department stores, said it would emphasize its strongest-selling merchandise, including appliances, a market category in which Ward ranks second in terms of sales volume in the United States. The company also is the No. 3 furniture retailer and the biggest U.S. seller of mattresses.
In addition, the company said its jewelry sales rank among the top five on a volume-per-store basis in the United States.

The privately held company, a unit of Montgomery Ward Holding Corp, has not decided whether to close under-performing stores, Gustafson said. Ward also is talking with lenders about modifying terms of debt agreements.
